items.label: thm-mean-field-equation
items.title: The Mean-Field Equations for the Euclidean Gas
items.content:
615: :label: thm-mean-field-equation
616: 
617: The evolution of the Euclidean Gas in the mean-field limit is governed by a coupled system of equations for the alive density $f(t,z)$ and the dead mass $m_d(t)$:
618: 
619: **Equation for the Alive Density:**
620: 
621: $$
622: \boxed{
623: \partial_t f = L^\dagger f - c(z)f + B[f, m_d] + S[f]
624: }
625: $$ (eq-mean-field-pde-main)
626: 
627: **Equation for the Dead Mass:**
628: 
629: $$
630: \boxed{
631: \frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d}t} m_d(t) = \int_{\Omega} c(z)f(t,z)\,\mathrm{d}z - \lambda_{\text{rev}} m_d(t)
632: }
633: $$ (eq-dead-mass-ode)
634: 
635: subject to initial conditions $f(0, \cdot) = f_0$ and $m_d(0) = 1 - \int_\Omega f_0$, where $m_a(0) + m_d(0) = 1$.
636: 
637: In explicit form, the equation for $f$ is:
638: 
639: $$
640: \partial_t f(t,z) = -\nabla\cdot(A(z) f(t,z)) + \nabla\cdot(\mathsf{D}\nabla f(t,z)) - c(z)f(t,z) + \lambda_{\text{revive}} m_d(t) \frac{f(t,z)}{m_a(t)} + S[f](t,z)
641: $$
642: 
643: where:
644: *   $A(z)$ is the drift field and $\mathsf{D}$ is the diffusion tensor from the kinetic transport (with reflecting boundaries)
645: *   $c(z)$ is the interior killing rate (zero in interior, positive near boundary)
646: *   $\lambda_{\text{revive}} > 0$ is the revival rate (free parameter, typical values 0.1-5)
647: *   $B[f, m_d] = \lambda_{\text{revive}} m_d(t) f/m_a$ is the revival operator
648: *   $S[f]$ is the mass-neutral internal cloning operator
items.raw_directive:
612: By assembling all operators—kinetic transport, interior killing, revival, and internal cloning—we arrive at a **coupled system** that describes the evolution of both the alive density and the dead mass.

items.label: thm-mass-conservation
items.title: Total Mass Conservation and Population Dynamics
items.content:
674: :label: thm-mass-conservation
675: 
676: Any sufficiently regular solution $(f(t,z), m_d(t))$ to the Mean-Field Equations satisfies the following properties:
677: 
678: **1. Total Mass Conservation:** The total population is conserved for all time $t>0$:
679: 
680: $$
681: \frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d}t}\left[m_a(t) + m_d(t)\right] = 0
682: $$
683: 
684: where $m_a(t) = \int_\Omega f(t,z)\,\mathrm{d}z$. This implies that $m_a(t) + m_d(t) = 1$ for all $t$ if this holds initially.
685: 
686: **2. Alive Population Dynamics:** The alive mass evolves according to the balance between killing and revival:
687: 
688: $$
689: \frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d}t}m_a(t) = \lambda_{\text{rev}} m_d(t) - k_{\text{killed}}[f](t)
690: $$
items.raw_directive:
671: The primary property of this coupled system is that it conserves **total population mass** while allowing the alive and dead populations to exchange mass and reach a dynamic equilibrium.
672: 
673: :::{prf:theorem} Total Mass Conservation and Population Dynamics
674: :label: thm-mass-conservation
675: 
676: Any sufficiently regular solution $(f(t,z), m_d(t))$ to the Mean-Field Equations satisfies the following properties:
677: 
678: **1. Total Mass Conservation:** The total population is conserved for all time $t>0$:
679: 
680: $$
681: \frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d}t}\left[m_a(t) + m_d(t)\right] = 0
682: $$
683: 
684: where $m_a(t) = \int_\Omega f(t,z)\,\mathrm{d}z$. This implies that $m_a(t) + m_d(t) = 1$ for all $t$ if this holds initially.
685: 
686: **2. Alive Population Dynamics:** The alive mass evolves according to the balance between killing and revival:
687: 
688: $$
689: \frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d}t}m_a(t) = \lambda_{\text{rev}} m_d(t) - k_{\text{killed}}[f](t)
690: $$

items.label: thm-killing-rate-consistency
items.title: Consistency of the Interior Killing Rate Approximation
items.content:
836: :label: thm-killing-rate-consistency
837: 
838: Under Assumptions [](#asmp-domain-regularity), [](#asmp-integrator-regularity), and [](#asmp-density-regularity-killing), there exists a smooth killing rate function $c \in C^\infty_c(\Omega)$ with compact support in $\mathcal{T}_\delta$ such that:
839: 
840: **Part (i): Pointwise Convergence of the Exit Rate**
841: 
842: For each $(x,v) \in \Omega$, define the discrete exit probability:
843: 
844: $$
845: p_{\text{exit}}(x,v,\tau) := \mathbb{P}\left(x^+(\tau; x,v) \notin X_{\text{valid}}\right)
846: $$
847: 
848: Then:
849: 
850: $$
851: \lim_{\tau \to 0} \frac{1}{\tau} p_{\text{exit}}(x,v,\tau) = c(x,v)
852: $$
853: 
854: where the killing rate is given explicitly by:
855: 
856: $$
857: c(x,v) = \begin{cases}
858: \frac{(v \cdot n_x(x))^+}{d(x)} \cdot \mathbf{1}_{d(x) < \delta} & \text{if } x \in \mathcal{T}_\delta \\
859: 0 & \text{otherwise}
860: \end{cases}
861: $$
862: 
863: with $(v \cdot n_x(x))^+ := \max(v \cdot n_x(x), 0)$ denoting the outward normal velocity component.
864: 
865: **Part (ii): Uniform Convergence of the Expected Killing Fraction**
866: 
867: Define the expected killing fraction in a discrete timestep as:
868: 
869: $$
870: K_{\text{discrete}}(\tau) := \int_{\Omega} p_{\text{exit}}(x,v,\tau) f^\tau(x,v)\,\mathrm{d}x\,\mathrm{d}v
871: $$
872: 
873: and the continuous killing rate as:
874: 
875: $$
876: K_{\text{continuous}} := \int_{\Omega} c(x,v) f(x,v)\,\mathrm{d}x\,\mathrm{d}v
877: $$
878: 
879: Then:
880: 
881: $$
882: \lim_{\tau \to 0} \frac{1}{\tau} K_{\text{discrete}}(\tau) = K_{\text{continuous}}
883: $$
884: 
885: with the error bound:
886: 
887: $$
888: \left|\frac{1}{\tau} K_{\text{discrete}}(\tau) - K_{\text{continuous}}\right| \le C \left(\sqrt{\tau} + \|f^\tau - f\|_{L^1}\right)
889: $$

items.label: thm-mean-field-limit-informal
items.title: Mean-Field Limit (Informal Statement)
items.content:
1340: :label: thm-mean-field-limit-informal
1341: 
1342: Let $(X_i^\tau(t), V_i^\tau(t))_{i=1}^N$ be the $N$-particle discrete Fragile Gas dynamics with timestep $\tau$, and let:
1343: 
1344: $$
1345: f_N^\tau(t, x, v) := \frac{1}{N} \sum_{i=1}^N \delta(x - X_i^\tau(t), v - V_i^\tau(t))
1346: $$
1347: 
1348: be the empirical density. Then, in the joint limit $N \to \infty, \tau \to 0$ with $\tau = O(N^{-\alpha})$ for $\alpha > 0$:
1349: 
1350: $$
1351: f_N^\tau(t, \cdot, \cdot) \xrightarrow{\text{weak}} f(t, \cdot, \cdot)
1352: $$

1337: The killing rate consistency theorem (Theorem [](#thm-killing-rate-consistency)) provides the final piece needed to justify our mean-field model. Combined with the standard kinetic theory arguments for the transport operator $L^\dagger$ (Section 2.2) and the Law of Large Numbers for the cloning operators (Section 2.3), we obtain:
